title: How to Make Vegan Mug Cake

steps.headline: Grease the mug.
steps.description: Lightly spread vegetable oil, canola oil, or vegan butter along the insides of the mug to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Add ingredients.
steps.description: Place flour, peanut butter, plant milk, sweetener, baking powder and vanilla extract into the mug.

steps.headline: Mix it up.
steps.description: Mix the ingredients together with a stirring utensil until a batter forms.

steps.headline: Cook the cake.
steps.description: Cook the cake for one minute in the microwave or 20-25 minutes in a 375°F (190°C) preheated oven. Cook the cake a bit longer if undercooked.

steps.headline: Add toppings.
steps.description: Garnish the mug cake with chocolate chunks or chips before serving.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Allow the cake to cool for a couple minutes before eating.

steps.headline: Grease the mug.
steps.description: Lightly spread vegetable oil, canola oil, or vegan butter along the insides of the mug to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Add ingredients to blender.
steps.description: Place the banana, almond butter, and cocoa powder into a blender. Blend ingredients until smooth.

steps.headline: Add chocolate chips.
steps.description: Pour the batter into the greased mug. Sprinkle in the chocolate chips and fold them into the mixture.

steps.headline: Cook for one minute.
steps.description: Place the mug into the microwave and allow to cook for one minute or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Remove the cake from the microwave and dig in!

steps.headline: Grease the mug.
steps.description: Rub some cooking oil or vegan butter along the inside of the mug to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Add ingredients.
steps.description: Place the flour, carrots, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, water, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and walnuts into the mug.

steps.headline: Mix together.
steps.description: Using a spoon mix everything together until well combined.

steps.headline: Cook for two minutes.
steps.description: Place the mug into the microwave for two minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

steps.headline: Cool for 1-2 minutes.
steps.description: Allow the cake to cool for 1-2 minutes or until it's not steaming hot.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add some toppings such as more cinnamon or vegan whipped cream and enjoy your cake straight from the mug.

text: Vegan Peanut Butter Mug Cake Grease the mug. Lightly spread vegetable oil, canola oil, or vegan butter along the insides of the mug to prevent sticking. Add ingredients. Place flour, peanut butter, plant milk, sweetener, baking powder and vanilla extract into the mug. Mix it up. Mix the ingredients together with a stirring utensil until a batter forms. Cook the cake. Cook the cake for one minute in the microwave or 20-25 minutes in a 375°F (190°C) preheated oven. Cook the cake a bit longer if undercooked. Add toppings. Garnish the mug cake with chocolate chunks or chips before serving. Serve. Allow the cake to cool for a couple minutes before eating. Vegan Chocolate Mug Cake Grease the mug. Lightly spread vegetable oil, canola oil, or vegan butter along the insides of the mug to prevent sticking. Add ingredients to blender. Place the banana, almond butter, and cocoa powder into a blender. Blend ingredients until smooth. Add chocolate chips. Pour the batter into the greased mug. Sprinkle in the chocolate chips and fold them into the mixture. Cook for one minute. Place the mug into the microwave and allow to cook for one minute or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Serve. Remove the cake from the microwave and dig in! Vegan Carrot Mug Cake Grease the mug. Rub some cooking oil or vegan butter along the inside of the mug to prevent sticking. Add ingredients. Place the flour, carrots, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, water, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and walnuts into the mug. Mix together. Using a spoon mix everything together until well combined. Cook for two minutes. Place the mug into the microwave for two minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool for 1-2 minutes. Allow the cake to cool for 1-2 minutes or until it's not steaming hot. Serve. Add some toppings such as more cinnamon or vegan whipped cream and enjoy your cake straight from the mug.
